2. activate Mothdust Changeling, tap target creature you control, Mothdust Changeling gains flying
3. Mothdost Changeling could not be activated a second time What is the expected output? What do you see instead? you should get to activate Mothdust Changeling as much as you control untapped creatures, including Mothdust Changeling itself What version of the product are you using? author: [Landhotel.Westerwald](https://code.google.com/u/Landhotel.Westerwald/)
title: Mothdust Cangeling: ability can be used only once

comments.body:
It looks like the 'gain ability' abilities for creature that give themselves an ability have a condition that they don't already have the ability.

I would guess this is to prevent the AI from repeatedly giving a creature an ability it already has.

**Status:** Accepted
comments.author: [ShawnieBoyUK](https://code.google.com/u/ShawnieBoyUK/)

comments.body:
my testdeck:

# 10 creatures
4 Coralhelm Commander
4 Fallowsage
4 Judge of Currents
2 Lord of Atlantis
4 Master of Waves
2 Master of the Pearl Trident
4 Mothdust Changeling
4 Stonybrook Schoolmaster
2 Surgespanner
2 Veteran of the Depths

# 4 spells
4 Merrow Commerce
4 Mox Pearl
4 Mox Sapphire
4 Paradise Mantle

# 3 lands
4 Glacial Fortress
4 Hallowed Fountain
4 Tundra

the Mothdust Changeling would be an excellent way to tap all these merfolks with tap abilities, plus it gets stronger for being merfolk and elemental, plus it gains flying. I like this card.

Apropos AI: once I saw the AI doing something very weird with Paradis Mantle. It equipped one creature with it, than tapped that creature for mana to hand the Paradise Mantle to the next creature. 7 times in a row, effectivly tapping all its available creatures. On the one hand it was annoying, because it needed quite some time... but on the other hand it gave me this idea.
